title: From campaign stunt to ‘double-tap’ strikes: A brief history of militarizing drug enforcement

author: Julia Shapero
description: Two key AI provisions were left out of the final text of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) after failing to overcome Republican divisions, while a pair of measures restricting investments and contracts with China made it into the must-pass defense bill.  The legislation, which could receive a vote as early as this week, became a battleground for major fights over tech policy in recent weeks, as lawmakers grappled with the future of AI in the…
title: Here are key tech provisions the NDAA includes and excludes

author: Filip Timotija
description: Trinidad and Tobago’s military comprises fewer than 6,000 soldiers, placing it among the smallest on the South American continental shelf. Still, located just 7 miles from Venezuela at their closest point, the tiny dual-island nation is playing a key role in President Trump’s ongoing standoff against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Joint Chiefs of Staff Chair…
title: How this tiny island nation plays a key role in the Trump-Maduro standoff

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: President Trump and Education Secretary Linda McMahon have spent the first year of the second Trump administration working hard to fulfill his campaign promise to close the Education Department.   From mass layoffs to moving programs to other federal agencies, McMahon is doing what she can to follow Trump’s executive order to dismantle her department.…
title: McMahon’s first year has decimated the Education Department, but full elimination hovers out of reach

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump is set to travel to Pennsylvania on Tuesday to deliver a speech on the economy, a tacit acknowledgment that he and the White House must do more to address voters’ concerns about heightened costs for Americans. Trump has so far in his second term made sparingly few domestic trips to tout his agenda,…
title: Trump to tout economic agenda in Pennsylvania as voters sour on costs

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Swing-state Republican senators who are up for reelection are scrambling for political cover as the Senate prepares to vote on a Democratic bill to extend health insurance tax credits, even as the GOP struggles to coalesce behind a plan. Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) told reporters Monday that Republicans won’t necessarily put up a…
title: Vulnerable Republicans sweat amid GOP divisions on health care

author: Tara Suter
description: Cheryl Hines, the wife of Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., said her husband is “not going to run for president” in 2028. “Cheryl, is your husband going to run for president in 2028, and if so, are you ready for that?” NewsNation’s Elizabeth Vargas asked Hines on her show. “Gosh,…
title: Cheryl Hines: RFK Jr. ‘not going to run for president’ in 2028

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Jasmine Crockett (D-Texas) on Monday posted a Senate campaign launch video that features audio of President Trump insulting her. “Texas, let’s win this thing. #JasmineForUS #TexasTough,” Crockett wrote in a post on the social platform X on Monday. Crockett’s post also featured a video in which she is facing sideways while audio clips of…
title: Crockett’s Senate launch video highlights audio of Trump insulting her

author: Caroline Vakil
description: An Indiana Senate panel has advanced a new House map that aims to give Republicans two additional pickup opportunities next year, though questions remain on whether it has enough support to be passed by the full chamber. The Indiana Senate Committee on Elections passed an aggressive GOP-favored House map 6-3 on Monday, just days after…
title: Indiana Senate panel advances new House map, teeing up final vote

author: Rachel Frazin
description: A federal judge on Monday rejected the Trump administration’s effort to halt approvals for all new wind energy projects — dealing a blow to the president’s efforts to hamper renewable energy. Judge Patti Saris, appointed by former President Clinton, ruled that moves from the Interior Department, Commerce Department, Environmental Protection Agency and Army Corps of…
title: Court rejects Trump’s pause on wind approvals
